body_html:
@mrry : Thanks for your help! Adding a ./ did solve the problem. Although a trivial solution, it took me a long time to figure this out.
Also, don't you think models should be loaded even without that? Many of the existing tensorflow models available on github and elsewhere simply specify adding a model.ckpt without a ./ to load an existing checkpoint.
body_text:
@mrry : Thanks for your help! Adding a ./ did solve the problem. Although a trivial solution, it took me a long time to figure this out.
Also, don't you think models should be loaded even without that? Many of the existing tensorflow models available on github and elsewhere simply specify adding a model.ckpt without a ./ to load an existing checkpoint.
body:
@mrry : Thanks for your help! Adding a `./` did solve the problem. Although a trivial solution, it took me a long time to figure this out. 
Also, don't you think models should be loaded even without that? Many of the existing tensorflow models available on github and elsewhere simply specify adding a `model.ckpt` without a `./` to load an existing checkpoint.
